column2: "WASHINGTON (AP) â€” Intelligence reports compiled by the U.S. Capitol Police in the days before last yearâ€™s insurrection envisioned only an improbable or remote risk of violence
column3: even as other assessments warned that crowds of potentially thousands of pro-Trump demonstrators could converge in Washington and create a dangerous situation.//WASHINGTON (AP) â€” Intelligence reports compiled by the U.S. Capitol Police in the days before last yearâ€™s insurrection envisioned only an improbable or remote risk of violence
column4: even as other assessments warned that crowds of potentially thousands of pro-Trump demonstrators could converge in Washington and create a dangerous situation.//The documents
column5: obtained by The Associated Press
column6: underscore the uneven and muddled intelligence that circulated to Capitol Police officers ahead of the Jan. 6 riot
column7: when thousands of Donald Trump loyalists swarmed the Capitol complex and clashed violently with law enforcement officers in their effort to disrupt the certification of the results of the 2020 presidential election. The intelligence reports in particular show how the police agency
column8: up to the day of the riot itself

column18: and what he did during those crucial hours when the U.S. Capitol was overrun by his supporters. And beyond the president

As his supporters smashed windows

column25: Trump watched from his private dining room off of the Oval Office

But at the moment

column54: alleged in a letter that Hannity had expressed â€œconcernsâ€ and provided â€œadviceâ€ to Trump and White House staff about their plans for Jan. 6
column55: and â€œhad relevant communications while the riot was underway.â€//The letter also contained text messages Hannity wrote. In one sent the evening of Jan. 5

column57: exactly.//Trump supporters were plotting the events of Jan. 6 weeks and even months before it happened. The signs were right out in the open as well as on more obscure sites; people from across the country were coordinating rides to Washington

column87: was deputized with this exact assignment to watch and monitor extremism and interrupt it before it led to a criminal plot
column89: referring to the FBIâ€™s network of â€œfusion centersâ€ that are supposed to monitor and share intelligence across agencies. A lot of the planning messages Leonnig came across discussed what seemed to be clearly illegal activity
column90: such as how to smuggle in guns and how to use secure communication methods after breaking into the Capitol.//â€œI mean
column92: â€ Leonnig said of the agencies.//As a backdrop to the Capitol attack
column93: the weeks leading up to it were some of the most tense of the Trump administration. Justice Department officials â€• including people in charge of the FBI and the attorney generalâ€™s office â€• were on edge wondering whether Trump would fire their leadership and throw their institutions into turmoil out of frustration over having lost the election.//Former Capitol Police Chief Steven Sund attempted to request National Guard help on Jan. 3
column94: but he lacked key information about the extent of the threat and his request was rejected.//Thanks to delays and confusion
column95: around three hours passed between the point when protesters breached the Capitol and when law enforcement began to get a handle on the situation. Officials had recognized the need for National Guard assistance within the first 10 minutes; at 2:22 p.m.
column96: D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser requested help from the National Guard on a call with Army Secretary Ryan McCarthy and other law enforcement officials
column97: according to an official record. But the request was not immediately approved by acting Defense Secretary Christopher Miller. Law enforcement finally finished their sweep of the Capitol around 8 p.m.//The Washington Postâ€™s investigation underscored previous reports that some top military leaders were concerned about the optics of having the National Guard on hand to block a political protest. Some were concerned that Trump might try to use the National Guard for his own ends.//Military leaders have so far given conflicting accounts of the delay. The Jan. 6 committee will likely provide more concrete and substantial answers in a final report.//There was also a legal insurrection underway leading up to Jan. 6
column98: and it was just as dangerous to democracy
column99: if not as visible. We know Trump pressured local election officials in at least one state â€• Georgia â€• to â€œfindâ€ enough votes to tip the scales of the election. We know someone under his thumb
